import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Activate SLA"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/slas/{SlaId}/activate"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Activates a service level agreement, enabling it to be applied to tickets. An active SLA defines response and resolution time targets that help ensure consistent service quality.

**Prerequisites**
1. **SlaId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) to list available SLAs. Extract `Items[].SlaId` from the response.

**Workflow Example**
1. List SLAs: [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) â†’ find the SLA you want to activate
2. Activate: [POST /api/v1.0/slas/\{SlaId\}/activate](/docs/api/slas/activate-sla)

**Notes**: Only inactive SLAs can be activated. Activating an SLA makes it available for assignment to tickets. Use [POST /api/v1.0/slas/\{SlaId\}/deactivate](/docs/api/slas/deactivate-sla) to disable an SLA.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

  parameters={[{"name":"Client","in":"header","required":false,"example":"WebBrowser","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"ProductId","in":"header","required":false,"example":0,"schema":{"type":"integer"}},{"name":"Authorization","in":"header","required":false,"example":"{{BasicAuth}}","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"SiteId","in":"header","required":false,"example":"{{SiteId}}","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"SlaId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"description":"The unique identifier of the SLA"}]}

</ParamsDetails>
